Finally, the #InflationReductionAct honors our promise to families ‚Äì and is fully paid for. We‚Äôre able to do this by ensuring the biggest corporations & ultra-wealthy pay their fair share. NO new taxes on families making $400,000 or less & NO new taxes on small businesses.

The #InflationReductionAct invests in making WIDE-SCALE manufacturing, supply chains & transportation cleaner, which will help alleviate inflation, reduce the risk of future price shocks by bringing down the cost of clean energy/clean vehicles & relieving supply chain issues.

The #InflationReductionAct is making the largest investment in addressing climate change in history and cutting emissions by roughly 40 percent by 2030. No bill is perfect but this one is certainly historic.

Building on regular engagement with Environmental Justice leaders from across the country, the #InflationReductionAct includes over $60 billion in funding for community-led projects in neighborhoods ‚Äì too often low-income ‚Äì bearing the brunt of pollution & climate change.

The #InflationReductionAct will provide rebates to low-income consumers to make homes energy efficient, unlocking the green economy for many. Energy efficient retrofits, electric appliances, clean heat pumps, rooftop solar, electric HVAC & water heaters will be more affordable.

On climate and energy, for the FIRST time, used electric & hybrid vehicles will qualify for up to a $4000 tax credit, making clean cars more accessible in our communities. The only way to spur widespread adoption of clean vehicles is to make them more affordable.

According to the Government Accountability Office, retail prices that U.S. consumers & insurers paid for 20 brand-name prescription drugs in 2020 were 2.82x higher than in Canada, 4.25x higher than in Australia, and 4.36x higher than in France. This bill will lower drug costs.

The #InflationReductionAct will empower Medicare to negotiate drug prices for the FIRST time on the highest cost single-source drugs in Medicare, a policy that Republicans have blocked for years! U.S. pays 2x to 4x more for prescriptions than similar countries. This will help.

Seniors on Medicare for the FIRST time will have their prescription drug costs capped at $2,000/yr, including a maximum $35 a month on insulin. Make sure to tell any older person on Medicare and who depends on insulin about this - it‚Äôs a big deal.

On health care, the #InflationReductionAct means that nearly 26,000 people in CA-34 will continue to save $931 a year in premiums on Covered California. Health care is a human right and this bill gets us another step closer to that.

In a nutshell, the #InflationReductionAct is a historic bill focused on lowering families‚Äô health care costs, drug & energy costs, making the largest investment in addressing climate change in history, cutting emissions by roughly 40% by 2030 & dramatically reducing the deficit.

The #InflationReductionAct requires drug companies to rebate the difference back to Medicare if prices rise higher than inflation.

Seniors are the only group for whom vaccines are not already free.

Many of the #InflationReductionAct's biggest wins are for seniors living on fixed incomes.
